availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Smith (Fayette County, KY, physician and curator of Kentucky University)

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, physician and university curator. Kentucky native. Married to Margaret Jane Rogers Smith in Madison County on January 2, 1839. Father of Samuel R. Smith, John E. Smith, Joseph I. Smith, Robert H. Smith, Bowman Smith, William Smith, Joanna Smith, and Milton Smith. Physician in Boyle County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Boyle County in 1850. Physician in Boyle County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Boyle County in 1860. Member of the board of curators of Kentucky University in 1865.
